intro: Combretum hereroense subsp. grotei, commonly known as the Herero combretum, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in savanna and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. The subspecies grotei is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
